introduction.p: Find the domain and range of each function from its graph.
State the domain and range of each basic function.

li.p: Domain: all real numbers; Range: all real numbers
Domain: all real numbers; Range: [0, \infty)
Domain: all real numbers except zero; Range: (0, \infty)
Domain: all real numbers except zero; Range: all real numbers except zero

statement.p: The graph shows the elevation of the Los Angeles Marathon course as a function of the distance into the race, a = f (t). Estimate the domain and range of the function. (Source: Los Angeles Times)

The graph shows the federal debt as a percentage of the gross domestic product, as a function of time, D = f (t). Estimate the domain and range of the function. (Source: Office of Management and Budget)
The graph shows the average air temperature as a function of altitude, T = f (h). Estimate the domain and range of the function. (Source: Ahrens, 1998)
The graph shows the speed of sound in the ocean as a function of depth, S = f (d). Estimate the domain and range of the function. (Source: Scientific American)

Clinton purchases \$6000 of photographic equipment to set up his studio. He estimates a salvage value of \$500 for the equipment in 10 years, and for tax purposes he uses straight-line depreciation.
Write a formula for the value of the equipment, V(t), after t years.
State the domain and range of the function V(t).

Leslie plans to invest some money in two CD accounts. The first account pays 3.6\% interest per year, and the second account pays 2.8\% interest per year. Leslie would like to earn \$500 per year on her investment.
Write a linear equation in general form that relates x, the amount Leslie invests at 3.4%, and y, the amount she invests at 2.8%.
Use your equation from part (a) to write y as a function of x, y = f (x).
Find the domain and range of f.

The height of a golfball, in feet, t seconds after being hit is given by the function h = -16t^2 + 64t.
Graph the function.
State the domain and range of the function and explain what they tell us about the golfball.

li.p: Domain: [0, 4]; Range: [0, 64]

statement.p:
Gameworld is marketing a new boardgame called Synaps. If Gameworld charges p dollars for the game, its revenue, R, is given by the function R = 1000p - 50p^2.
Graph the function.
State the domain and range of the function and explain what they tell us about the revenue.

In New York City, taxi cabs charge \$2.50 for distances up to \dfrac{1}{3} mile, plus \$0.40 for each additional \dfrac{1}{5} mile or portion thereof. (Source: www.visitnyc.com)
Sketch a graph of F(d), which gives taxi fare as a function of distance traveled, on the domain 0\lt d \le 1.
State the range of F(d) on that domain.
How much will it cost Renee to travel by taxi from Columbia University to Rockefeller Center, a distance of 5.7 miles?
If you order from Coldwater Creek, the shipping charges are given by the following table.

Purchaseamount Shippingcharge
Up to $25 \$5.95
$25.01 to \$50 \$7.95
$50.01 to \$75 \$9.95
$75.01 to \$100 \$10.95
State the domain and range of S(x), the shipping charge as a function of the purchase amount, x.

The Bopp-Busch Tool and Die Company markets its products to individuals, to contractors, and to wholesale distributors. The company offers three different price structures for its toggle bolts. If you order 20 or fewer boxes, the price is \$2.50 each. If you order more than 20 but no more than 50 boxes, the price is \$2.25 each. If you order more than 50 boxes, the price is $2.10 each. State the domain and range of C(x), the cost of ordering x boxes of toggle bolts.

answer.p: Domain: nonnegative integers; The range includes all whole number multiples of 2.50 up to 20\times 2.50 = 50, all integer multiples of 2.25 from 21\times 2.25 = 47.25 to 50 × 2.25 = 112.50 and all integer multiples of 2.10 from 51\times 2.10 = 107.10 onwards: 0, 2.50, 5.00, 7.50, \ldots, 50, 47.25, 49.50, 51.75, \ldots , 112.50, 107.10, 109.20, 111.30, \ldots

statement.p:
The Java Stop uses paper cups at a rate of 300 per day. At opening on Tuesday morning Java Stop has on hand 1200 paper cups. On Friday mornings Java Stop takes delivery of a week's worth of cups.
Write a piecewise function for the number of cups Java Stop has on hand for one week, starting Tuesday morning.
Graph the function.
State the domain and range of the function.

introduction.p: Find the domain of each function algebraically. Then graph the function, and use the graph to help you find the range.

li.p:
f (x) domain: x \ne 4; Range: (0,\infty)
horizontally shifted reciprocal-squared

h (x) domain: x \ne 0; Range: (-4,\infty)
vertically shifted reciprocal-squared

G(v) domain: all real numbers; Range: all real numbers
vertically shifted reciprocal

H(v) domain: all real numbers; Range: all real numbers
horizontally shifted reciprocal

G(v) domain: [2,\infty); Range: [0,\infty)
horizontally shifted root

H(v) domain: [0,\infty); Range: [-2,\infty)
vertically shifted root

introduction.p: Decide whether the given value is in the range of the function. If so, find the domain value(s) that produce each range value.

li.p: Not in range
x = -6 or x = 2
Not in range
Not in range

introduction.p:
For Problems 3950,
Use a graphing calculator to graph each function on the given domain. Using the TRACE key, adjust Ymin and Ymax until you can estimate the range of the function.
Verify your answer algebraically by evaluating the function. State the domain and range in interval notation.

li.p: Show that the graph of y=\sqrt{16-x^2} is a semicircle.

hint.p: (Hint: Write the equation in the form x^2 + y^2 = r^2. See Algebra Skills Refresher to review circles.)

li.p: State the domain and range of the function.

Graph the function in the window
\small{\text{Xmin}} \amp = -6 \amp\amp \small{\text{Xmax}} = 6
\small{\text{Ymin}} \amp = 0 \amp\amp \small{\text{Ymax}} = 8
In what way is the calculator’s graph misleading?

Squaring both sides of the equation gives the equation of the circle centered on the origin with radius 4, but the points in the third and fourth quadrants are extraneous solutions introduced by squaring. (The original equation allowed only y\ge 0.)
Domain: [-4, 4]; Range: [0, 4]

GC graph
The calculator does not show the graph extending down to the x-axis.
For what values of x is the function y = \dfrac{2x - 8}{x-2} undefined?
Graph the function in the standard window. In what way is the calculator's graph misleading?

Graph the function in the window
\small{\text{Xmin}} \amp = -9.4 \amp\amp \small{\text{Xmax}} = 9.4
\small{\text{Ymin}} \amp = -10 \amp\amp \small{\text{Ymax}} = 10
State the domain and range of the function.

introduction.p: In Problems 5360, find the domain and range of each transformation of the given function.

li.p: Domain: x \ne 2; Range: (0, \infty)
Domain: x \ne 0; Range: (-2, \infty)
Domain: x \ne 3; Range: (-5, \infty)
Domain: all real numbers; Range: (-\infty,0)
Domain: all real numbers; Range: (-\infty,6)
Domain: all real numbers; Range: (-\infty,6)

statement.p:
The domain of f is [0, 10] and the range is [-2, 2].
y=f(x-3)
y=3f(x)
y=2f(x-5)

li.p: Domain: [3,13]; Range: [-2,2])
Domain: [0,10]; Range: [-6,6]
Domain: [5,15]; Range: [-4,4]

statement.p:
The domain of f is [-4, 4] and the range is [3, 10].
y=f(x)+10
y=f(x+10)
y=f(x-1)+4

The domain of f is (0,+\infty) and the range is (0, 1).
y=5f(x)
y=3f(x+2)
y=2f(x-3)+2

li.p: Domain: (0,\infty); Range: (0,5)
Domain: (-2,\infty); Range: (0,3)
Domain: (3,\infty); Range: (2,4)

statement.p:
The domain of f is (-1, 1) and the range is (-\infty, 0).
y=f(x+1)
y=3f(x+1)
y=4+2f(x-1)

introduction.p: In Problems 6164, use a graphing calculator to explore some properties of the basic functions.

li.p: Graph f (x) = x^2 and g(x) = x^3 on the domain [0, 1] and state the range of each function. On the interval (0, 1), which is greater, f (x) or g(x)?
Graph f (x) = x^2 and g(x) = x^3 on the domain [1, 10] and state the range of each function. On the interval (1, 100), which is greater, f(x) or g(x)?
Graph f (x) =\sqrt{x} and g(x) =\sqrt[3]{x} on the domain [0, 1] and state the range of each function. On the interval (0, 1), which is greater, f (x) or g(x)?
Graph f (x) = \sqrt{x} and g(x) = \sqrt[2]{x} on the domain [1, 100] and state the range of each function. On the interval (1, 100), which is greater, f(x) or g(x)?
Graph f (x) =\dfrac{1}{x} and g(x) = \dfrac{1}{x^2} on the domain [0.01, 1] and state the range of each function. On the interval (0, 1), which is greater, f (x) or g(x)?
Graph f (x) = \dfrac{1}{x} and g(x) = \dfrac{1}{x^2} on the domain [1, 10] and state the range of each function. On the interval (1, \infty), which is greater, f(x) or g(x)?
Graph F (x) =\abs{x^3} in the ZDecimal window. How does the graph compare to the graph of y = x^3?
Graph G (x) = \abs{\dfrac{1}{x}} in the ZDecimal window. How does the graph compare to the graph of y = \dfrac{1}{x}?
